manifest.name: async-function
manifest.description: A function that returns the normally hidden `AsyncFunction` constructor

scripts.postversion: auto-changelog && git add CHANGELOG.md && git commit --no-edit --amend && git tag -f "v$(node -e "console.log(require('./package.json').version)")"

manifest.readme:
# async-function <sup>[![Version Badge][npm-version-svg]][package-url]</sup>

[![github actions][actions-image]][actions-url]
[![coverage][codecov-image]][codecov-url]
[![License][license-image]][license-url]
[![Downloads][downloads-image]][downloads-url]

[![npm badge][npm-badge-png]][package-url]

A function that returns the normally hidden `AsyncFunction` constructor, when available.

## Getting started

```sh
npm install --save async-function
```

## Usage/Examples

```js
const assert = require('assert');
const AsyncFunction = require('async-function')();

const fn = new AsyncFunction('return 1');

assert.equal(fn.toString(), 'async function anonymous(\n) {\nreturn 1\n}');

fn().then(x => {
    assert.equal(x, 1);
});
```

## Tests

Clone the repo, `npm install`, and run `npm test`
